properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 9 at 4:43PM CST until January 11 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa OK
properties.description:
...WINTER WEATHER POSSIBLE FOR PARTS OF NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA FRIDAY
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY...

.Cold front forecast to push into the region Friday and Friday
night with much colder air filter into the region. This will allow
for a wintry mix of freezing rain and sleet to develop Friday
night before a change over to snow Saturday.

* WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow
accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of up to
one tenth of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 35
mph.

* WHERE...Osage, Washington OK and Pawnee Counties.

* WHEN...From late Friday night through Saturday morning.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery to hazardous road conditions. Areas
of blowing snow from the gusty winds could also reduce
visibility.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING
